Chapter 2 Protocols 2.1 Protocols for selection Constructing genetic relationship matrix \(\mathbf{G}\). The difference between a random mating population and inbred population is the way \(\mathbf{G}\) is constructed. So for a pair of individuals \(i\) and \(j\), \[G_{ij}=\frac{1}{\tilde{m}}\sum_l^{\tilde{m}}\frac{(x_{il}-2p_l)(x_{jl}-2p_l)}{2(1+F)p_lq_l}\] and \(F=1\) for inbred lines. Please refer to Chapter 1. Conducting eigenanalysis for \(\mathbf{G}\), see it definition (??). Linear regression analysis for each SNP. 2.2 Protocal for EigenGWAS A simple analysis pipeline written in Rscripts may be found at Rpub and its Shiny demo. Or, try it as below in RStudio runGitHub("Rshiny", "gc5k") 2.3 Protocol for predicted eigenvectors The prediction accuracy can be written as \[R^2 \approx \frac{1}{1+\frac{n_e}{m}}\]
